keywords: TfL,Old oyster card, new oyster card, first generation oyster card, replace oyster card
description: Information on how to replace first-generation Oyster cards

breadcrumbs.title: How to pay and where to buy tickets and Oyster

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["If you travel using a first-generation Oyster card, replace it with a new one to use our TfL Oyster and contactless app and manage your card on the go."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Check your card"}
Look on the back of your Oyster card. If it doesn't have a 'D' in the bottom left hand corner, it's a first-generation Oyster card.
If you have a contactless and Oyster account and you've added your Oyster card to it, you'll see a message confirming you have a first-generation Oyster card when you sign in.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Get a new Oyster card"}
You can get a new Oyster card online and at many locations across London.
You need to pay a £5 deposit and add a minimum amount of pay as you go credit, or a season ticket to your new card to use it straight away.

{"template":"table","titles":["Where to get an Oyster card","Minimum pay as you go credit"],"rows":[[],["Online","£5"],[" \u003ca href=\"/travel-information/visiting-london/getting-around-london/visitor-centres\"\u003eVisitor Centres\u003c/a\u003e ","£5"],[" \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/maps/oyster-ticket-stops\"\u003eOyster Ticket Stops\u003c/a\u003e ","£1.50"],["All Tube, London Overground and TfL Rail stations","£5"],["Some DLR and National Rail stations","£5"],["The Tramlink Shop, Croydon","£1.50"]]}
Once you've got your new Oyster card, you can use our TfL Oyster and contactless app .
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"What to do with your first-generation Oyster card"}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Transfer credit and/or season tickets"}
You can transfer any pay as you go credit and/or season tickets from your first-generation Oyster card to your new Oyster card, on your contactless and Oyster account .
It will take 30 minutes to transfer once you've touched in or out of your first journey with your new Oyster card.
Your first-generation Oyster card will then be stopped so no one can use it.
If you paid a deposit for your first-generation Oyster card, it will be refunded to your contactless and Oyster account.
If you set up Auto top-up on your first-generation Oyster card, it will be set up automatically on your new card.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Get a refund for your old card"}
You can get a refund for your pay as you go credit and deposit at Tube, London Overground and TfL Rail ticket machines or offices.
You can get a refund for your pay as you go credit, Travelcard, Bus & Tram Pass and deposit on your contactless and Oyster account .

You'll receive your credit refund in two days. Travelcard refunds are calculated on a pro-rata basis so you can keep using your Travelcard, on your first-generation Oyster card, until it expires and then swap to your new card.
Once you've received your refund, your first-generation Oyster card will be stopped so no one can use it.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Discounted season tickets"}
If you have a discounted season ticket on your first-generation Oyster card, it can't be transferred to a new Oyster card.

You can either wait until your current ticket expires and then get a new Oyster card. Or you can get a refund before getting your new card by contacting us on 0343 222 1234 ( call charges may apply ).
